revisions.revision: Weapon located and Seat values found...
Lots of string ids and some Spheres named
Added Standard header, fixed some values and plugin errors, added some AI info
fixed some values from the xml
Fixed a few bitmasks and added more info

enum16.name: Object Type
enum16.tooltip: changing this would not be wise

bit.name: Search Cardinal Direction Lightmaps on Failure
Extension Of Parent
bit.tooltip: object passes all function values to parent and uses parent's markers

bit.name: Use Static Massive Lightmap Sample
bit.tooltip: cast a ton of rays once and store the results for lighting

bit.name: Attach To Clusters By Dynamic Sphere
bit.tooltip: use this for the mac gun on spacestation

bit.name: Effects Created By This Object Do Not Spawn Objects In Multiplayer

float32.name: Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: marine 1.0, grunt 1.4, elite 0.9, hunter 0.5, etc.

float32.name: Dynamic Light Sphere Radius
float32.tooltip: sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

bit.name: Invert
bit.tooltip: result of function is one minus actual result

bit.name: Mapping Does Not Controls Active
bit.tooltip: the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive

bit.name: Always Active
bit.tooltip: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

bit.name: Random Time Offset
bit.tooltip: function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1

stringId.name: Import Name
stringId.tooltip: if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable

stringid.name: Turn Off With
stringid.tooltip: if the specified function is off, so is this function

float32.name: Minimum Value
float32.tooltip: function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

plugin.comment: for things that want to cause more or less collision damage

float32.name: Apply Collision Damage Scale
float32.tooltip: 0 means 1. 1 is standard scale. Some things may want to apply more damage

plugin.comment: 0 - means take default value from globals.globals
0 - means take default value from globals.globals

stringid.name: Variant Name
stringid.tooltip: if empty, may be used by any model variant

bit.name: Blend In HSV
bit.tooltip: blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space

bit.name: ...More Colors
bit.tooltip: blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

option.name: Silent
option.tooltip: ai will not respond to this sound

option.name: Quiet
option.tooltip: ai can hear this sound at any range

float32.name: Distance Of Evade Animation
float32.tooltip: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our evade animation to move us

float32.name: Distance Of Dive Animation
float32.tooltip: this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our dive animation to move us

float32.name: Stunned Movement Threshold
float32.tooltip: if we take this much damage in a short space of time we will play our 'stunned movement' animations

tagRef.name: Spawned Turret Character
tagRef.tooltip: automatically created character when this unit is driven

range16.name: Spawned Actor Count
range16.tooltip: number of actors which we spawn

float32.name: Spawned Velocity
float32.tooltip: velocity at which we throw spawned actors

stringId.name: Right Hand Node
stringId.tooltip: where the primary weapon is attached

stringId.name: Left Hand Node
stringId.tooltip: where the seconday weapon is attached (for dual-pistol modes)

stringId.name: Preferred Gun Node
stringId.tooltip: if found, use this gun marker

int16.name: Variant Number
int16.tooltip: variant number to use this dialogue with (must match the suffix in the permutations on the unit's model)

tagblock.name: Seats

bit.name: Locked
bit.tooltip: when occupied, prevents enemies from entering locked seats

bit.name: First Person Camera Slaved To Gun
AI Firing Disabled By Maximum Acceleration

float32.name: Turnover Time
float32.tooltip: how much time it takes to evict a rider from a flipped vehicle

float32.name: Listener Interpolation Factor
float32.tooltip: how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

tagblock.comment: when the unit velocity is 0, the yaw/pitch rates are the left values at [max speed reference], the yaw/pitch rates are the right values. the max speed reference is what the code uses to generate a clamped speed from 0..1 the exponent controls how midrange speeds are interpreted. IOW: As velocity exceeds 'min speed' and approaches 'max speed', turn rates are scaled from low --> high

float32.name: Minimum Speed Reference
float32.tooltip: Initial t is computed from velocity/(max speed - min speed)

float32.name: Speed Exponent
float32.tooltip: if >0, t is then modified by raising to this exponent and result is used to linearly interpolate yaw/pitch rates

float32.name: Entry Radius
float32.tooltip: how close to the entry marker a unit must be

degree.name: Entry Marker Cone Angle
degree.tooltip: angle from marker forward the unit must be

degree.name: Entry Marker Facing Angle
degree.tooltip: angle from unit facing the marker must be

enum16.name: Specific Type
enum16.tooltip: if your type corresponds to something in this list choose it

float32.name: Turn Scale
float32.tooltip: think of this as oversteer

float32.name: Speed Turn Penalty
float32.tooltip: (0 = none, 1 = can't turn at top speed)

enum16.name: Vehicle Size
enum16.tooltip: The size determine what kind of seats in larger vehicles it may occupy (i.e. small or large cargo seats)

plugin.comment: when the steering is off by more than the cusp angle the steering will overcompensate more and more. when it is less, it overcompensates less and less. the exponent should be something in the neighborhood of 2.0

float32.name: Engine Moment
float32.tooltip: higher moments make engine spin up slower

float32.name: Engine Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: higher moments make engine spin up slower

float32.name: Torque at Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: generally 0 for loading torque and something less than max torque for cruising torque

float32.name: Torque at Maximum Angular Velocity
float32.tooltip: generally 0 for loading torque and something less than max torque for cruising torque

float32.name: Flying Torque Scale
float32.tooltip: big vehicles need to scale this down. 0 defaults to 1, which is generally a good value. This is used with alien fighter physics

float32.name: Seat Entrance Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: how much do we scale the force the biped the applies down on the seat when he enters. 0 == no acceleration

float32.name: Seat Exit Acceleration Scale
float32.tooltip: how much do we scale the force the biped the applies down on the seat when he exits. 0 == no acceleration

float32.name: Air Friction Deceleration
float32.tooltip: human plane physics only. 0 is nothing. 1 is like thowing the engine to full reverse

float32.name: Thrust Scale
float32.tooltip: human plane physics only. 0 is default (1)

float32.name: Ground Friction
float32.tooltip: for friction based vehicles only

float32.name: Ground Depth
float32.tooltip: for friction based vehicles only

float32.name: Ground Damp Factor
float32.tooltip: for friction based vehicles only

float32.name: Ground Moving Friction
float32.tooltip: for friction based vehicles only

float32.name: Ground Maximum Slope 0
float32.tooltip: degrees 0-90

float32.name: Ground Maximum Slope 1
float32.tooltip: degrees 0-90. and greater than slope 0

float32.name: Anti Gravity Bank Lift
float32.tooltip: lift per WU.

float32.name: Steering Bank Reaction Scale
float32.tooltip: how quickly we bank when we steer

float32.name: Gravity Scale
float32.tooltip: value of 0 defaults to 1. .5 is half gravity

float32.name: Radius
float32.tooltip: generated from the radius of the hkConvexShape for this vehicle

float32.name: Fraction Of Total Mass
float32.tooltip: (0.0-1.0) fraction of total vehicle mass

float32.name: Damaged Radius
float32.tooltip: radius when the tire is blown off.

enum16.name: Model State Destroyed
enum16.tooltip: only need point can destroy flag set

stringId.name: Region Name
stringId.tooltip: only need point can destroy flag set

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum16.name: Shape Type 0
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum16.name: Shape Type 1
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum16.name: Shape Type 2
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

enum16.name: Shape Type 3
enum16.tooltip: this and the shape index below becomes a pointer to the given shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: Runtime Code Pointer
uint32.tooltip: becomes a pointer in memory at runtime. don't poke me

uint32.name: User Data
uint32.tooltip: The offset from the start of the block to the start of this shape (index * block element size). This becomes a pointer to this shape in memory at runtime. don't poke me
